page.title: 04GRAFFHAM DRAMATIC SOCIETY
page.content: The Rustics began in 1950. Each play needs about 20 people including the producer, lights man, costumier, make-up artist, but about 50 are needed for musicals. They are always nervous but it adds to the excitement. They rehearse twice a week for 3 months and then daily for 2 weeks prior to the show. The operas are more popular. They audition and the costumes are made or hired and they alter them if they are not liked. They prefer the more elaborate costumes. They have to measure carefully when hiring and have problems fitting big men. They apply the make-up at home if it is easy but an expert does the complicated ones. A committee is in charge and makes decisions. In the interval they sell coffee and organge juice.
